text: Lions Clubs International (LCI) is an international non-political service organization founded originally in 1917 in Chicago, Illinois by Melvin Jones. It is now headquartered in Oak Brook, Illinois. , it had over 48,000 local clubs and more than 1.4 million members in over 200 countries around the world. == References == Category:1910s establishments in Illinois Category:1917 establishments in the United States Category:Organizations based in Illinois Category:Non-profit organizations of the United States
title: Lion's Club
